sg.edu.ntu.scse.cz2002.util

Class DateTimeFormatHelper

  • Object
    • DateTimeFormatHelper

  • public class DateTimeFormatHelper
extends Object
    Helper class for conversion of Calendar values to printable String values Helper class also contains validation methods for validating whether a certain date is valid
    Since:
    2019-04-01
    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    Francis Lim, Kenneth Soh

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        String of time formatted in HH:mm

      • formatToLocalDate

        public static LocalDate formatToLocalDate(String date)
                                   throws DateTimeParseException
        Formats a passed in String to a LocalDate object The String must strictly follow a given format: DD/MM/YYYY
        Parameters:
        date - String containing date in the specified format
        Returns:
        A LocalDate variable
        Throws:
        DateTimeParseException - When an incorrect format of date and time String has been passed in

      • formatToLocalTime

        public static LocalTime formatToLocalTime(String time)
                                   throws DateTimeParseException
        Formats a passed in String to a LocalTime object The String must strictly follow a given format: HH:MM
        Parameters:
        time - String containing time in the specified format
        Returns:
        A LocalTime variable
        Throws:
        DateTimeParseException - When an incorrect format of date and time String has been passed in

      • getTodayDate

        public static LocalDate getTodayDate(boolean getNextMonth)
        Method to get today's date or 30 days later in LocalDate object
        Parameters:
        getNextMonth - boolean variable to determine if getting today's date or date one month from now
        Returns:
        LocalDate object containing today's date and time value

      • getTimeNow

        public static LocalTime getTimeNow()
        Function to get time now (without date), in UTC+8 (Singapore Time)
        Returns:
        LocalTime variable containing the time now.

      • getTimeDifferenceMinutes

        public static long getTimeDifferenceMinutes(LocalTime time1,
                                            LocalTime time2)
        Method to compare between two times, determining how much time left until the desired time
        Parameters:
        time1 - first LocalTime attribute
        time2 - second LocalTime attribute
        Returns:
        long variable determining the time in minutesremaining from time1 until time2

      • compareIfBeforeToday

        public static boolean compareIfBeforeToday(LocalDate inputDate)
        Method for comparing if input date is after current date/time.
        Parameters:
        inputDate - LocalDate variable to be compared
        Returns:
        True is input date is after today, false if is same or before today.

      • formatMillisToDateTime

        public static String formatMillisToDateTime(long millis)
        Formats time since Unix Epoch (1/1/2017 00:00:00) to a DateTime String
        Parameters:
        millis - time in milliseconds since Epoch
        Returns:
        Formatted DateTime String

      • checkResvTimeSession

        public static boolean checkResvTimeSession(LocalTime resvTime,
                                           LocalTime sessionStart,
                                           LocalTime sessionEnd)
        Checks if resv time is between any of the AM or PM sessions
        Parameters:
        resvTime - User input reservation time formatted in HH:mm to LocalTime
        sessionStart - time of the start of session
        sessionEnd - time of the end of session
        Returns:
        boolean variable determining whether the resvTime falls between either session

      • formatToStringTodayDateTime

        @Deprecated
public static String formatToStringTodayDateTime()
        Deprecated. 
        Method for formatting Calendar values for current date/time into formatted String Note that "today" is a GregorianCalendar date. Method provides the same function as getting today's date, albeit in a String object as compared to a Calendar object. To get today's date as a calendar object, call getTodayDate()
        Returns:
        String of date and time formatted in DD/MM/YYYYY and HH:MM:SS.

      • validateDate

        public static boolean validateDate(String date)
                            throws InputMismatchException,
                                   ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Method for validating whether a user-input date is valid Method validates for the following: i) Months that only have 30 days ii) Years that are not leap-years. iii) For years that are leap-years, validate the date iv) Validates if month is valid v) Validates if the date is valid
        Parameters:
        date - String value unsplit containing date
        Returns:
        Boolean value determining if the date is valid or invalid
        Throws:
        InputMismatchException - If parsing to integer failed (e.g. received String input)
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If user input is anything other than dd/MM/yyyy (e.g. 08/2019343, 08/202019)

      • getSysTimeMillisWithSGTimeZone

        public static long getSysTimeMillisWithSGTimeZone()
        Method to add 8 hours to retrieval of system time to make it UTC+8 Note: Plus 8 hours = 28,800,000 millis
        Returns:
        currentTimeMillis plus 8 hours in long

      • validateDate

        @Deprecated
public static boolean validateDate(int d,
                                               int m,
                                               int y)
        Deprecated. 
        Method for validating whether a user-input date is valid Method validates for the following: i) Months that only have 30 days ii) Years that are not leap-years. iii) For years that are leap-years, validate the date iv) Validates if month is valid v) Validates if the date is valid
        Parameters:
        d - Integer value containing 2-digit DATE
        m - Integer value containing 2-digit MONTH
        y - Integer value containing YEAR value
        Returns:
        Boolean value determining if the date is valid or invalid
